UrbsÂ erat occiduisocciduus, -a, -um, adj.: western procul hinc notissima terris
indigenisindigena, -ae, f.: native, indigenous quondamquondam, adv.: once multos dominatadominor, -ari, -atus (+ abl.): to rule over per annos,
nunc vero HispaniHispanus, -a, -um, adj.: Spanish, populis MavorteMavors, -tis, m.: Mars (the god of war), war subactissubigo, -igere, -egi, -actum: to conquer,
sceptrasceptrum, -i, n. = imperium, -i tenent, summaque urbem dicionedicio, -onis, f.: authority gubernantguberno, -are: to rule.
content.question: According to the passage, which of the following statements describes the city (urbs, line 1)?

choices.label: Few people know that it exists.
It has been ruled by different people.
The Spanish were unable to conquer it.

content.answer: It has been ruled by different people.

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
